Detailed Description

Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when all the sounds are loaded.

The following example demonstrates how to use the ISoundPoolListener

 // MyISoundPoolListener

 class MyISoundPoolListener : ISoundPoolListener {
 public:
     MyISoundPoolListener();
     virtual ~MyISoundPoolListener();
     void onLoadComplete(SoundPool* soundPool, int32_t sampleId, int32_t status)
 };


 // MyISoundPoolListener

 void MyISoundPoolListener::onLoadComplete(SoundPool* soundPool, int32_t sampleId, int32_t status) {
    // Do something
    //.....

 }


 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState){

     // New a SoundPool instance.
     SoundPool *mpSoundPool = new SoundPool(3, AudioControl::STREAM_MUSIC, 0);

     // Load the sound from the specified APK resource.
     int32_t soundID1 = mpSoundPool->load(this, R::raw::sound1, 1);

       // New a listener
     MyISoundPoolListener *listener = new MyISoundPoolListener();

     // Set a listener
     mpSoundPool->setOnLoadCompleteListener(listener);

     // Play a sound from a sound ID.
     int32_t streamID = soundPool->play(soundID1 , 1.0, 1.0, 0, -1, 1.0);

     // ...

 }

virtual void gaia::media::ISoundPoolListener::onLoadComplete ( const SoundPool &  soundPool,
int32_t  sampleId,
int32_t  status 
) [virtual]

Called when a sound has completed loading.

Parameters:
soundPoolSoundPool object from the load() method
sampleIdthe sample ID of the sound loaded.
statusthe status of the load operation (0 = success)
